abstracts.cdata!:
The Programmatic Environment Structural
            Adjustment Loan Project, supports the first stage of
            Mexico's medium-term outcome-based program to promote
            sustainable development, and to mainstream environmental
            concerns in water, forestry, energy and tourism sectors.
            Mexico has met all the conditions of this operation, with
            the exception of three conditions, which have been met for
            the most part. Partial waivers are sought for these
            conditions: a) condition 1: the establishment of
            Inter-sectoral Technical Working Groups (ITWGs) in water,
            energy, tourism, and forestry; b) condition 8: ISO-9001-2000
            certification of certain environmental impact assessment
            (EIA) review and approval, forest fire detection and
            control, and permit-issuance functions of the Ministry of
            Environment and Natural Resources (SEMARNAT) that are to be
            decentralized to the state governments from SEMARNAT; and,
            c) condition 11: public disclosure of processing information
            of certain permits. Condition 1: the ITWGs have all been
            established and are functional. However, technically, a
            partial waiver is needed and warranted, given changes, in
            some cases, to ensure more appropriate representation in the
            ITWG than was originally envisaged during project
            preparation were needed, and also, because the agency in
            question underwent reorganization changes. Conditions 8 and
            11: the majority of functions related to EIA review,
            approval and permits, have been certified, and processing
            information of related permits is disclosed on public
            websites. The exceptions relate to forest fire detection and
            control (which was transferred out of SEMARNAT to the
            Forestry Commission (CONAFOR) following approval of a new
            Forestry Law) and, non-timber reporting (Permit No.
            SEMARNAT-03-005). The latter is likely to be delayed, since
            a complete review of permitting procedures is being
            conducted, and seemingly, some permits will be combined.
            Therefore it makes more sense to await completion of this
            review, prior to embarking on certification, and/or
            disclosure of permitting procedures. Based on the assessment
            that the objectives of the program have been met in
            substance, and that all conditions have been met with the
            exception of three conditions requiring minor partial
            waivers, it is proposed that the Second Tranche be made available.
